results.title: Grievous bodily harm
results.creator_credit: Mark Joffe, Richard Brennan, Australian Film Commission, FGH Film Consortium, Smiley Films and International Film Management
results.brief_description: Made in 1988, this police drama delves into the world of prostitution, corruption and redemption. Journalist Tom Stewart (Colin Friels) investigates a robbery and the death of a woman (Joy Bell) who was married to Morris Martin (John Waters) an obsessive man with a means to murder. Detective Ray Birch (Bruno Lawrence) is also investigating the robbery but is keeping information from Tom. The drama unfolds as the threads of connection appear between the main protagonists and it is revealed the woman actually faked her death to escape Martin. Cast includes: Kim Gyngell, Sandy Gore, John Flaus, Kerry Armstrong and Austen Tayshus.

results.title: Things to do in Denver when you're dead
results.creator_credit: Gary Fleder, Cary Woods and Miramax Films
results.brief_description: The plot centres around a motley gang of mobsters with names like Jimmy the Saint, Pieces, Franchise, Easy Wind and Critical Bill, all who are trying to go straight but are doomed to be called back for one final job. Jimmy the Saint’s (Andy Garcia) “Afterlife Advice” business for terminally ill clients (where they can videotape future advice for their loved ones) is falling into a hole rapidly. Needing some finance Jimmy turns to his old boss The Man With The Plan (Christopher Walken) for help but in return he has to do a favour for The Man - “rough up” The Man’s son’s ex-girlfriend’s new boyfriend! Jimmy calls in the old Gang and together they hatch an elaborate plan, a plan that ends up going horribly wrong. Stars Christopher Lloyd, William Forsythe, Bill Nunn, Treat Williams, Jack Warden, Steve Buscemi, Fairuza Balk.

results.title: Grave of the fireflies = Hotaru no Haka
results.creator_credit: Isao Takahata, Toru Hara and Studio Ghibli
results.brief_description: Majestic and tragic story of an adolescent boy and his little sister, made homeless by firebombing in Japan at the end of World War II and abandoned by callous relatives. Seita is a wily teenager, with the weight of the world on his shoulders as he seeks to find refuge and food for himself and Setsuko, his four year old sister who longs for their mother. After a disagreement with a distant aunt who briefly takes the pair in, Seita and Setsuko start living in an old shelter by the river. At first life is partially idyllic without adult presence; but soon the realities of homelessness start to take its toll on their health. This evocative and typically exceptional anime from Studio Ghibli, is a moving work and an extraordinary narrative about the Japanese experience of WW2. Disc 2 offers an array of fascinating support material.

results.title: Till human voices wake us
results.creator_credit: Michael Petroni, David Redman, Nigel Odell, Dean Murphy, Shana Levine, Thomas Augsberger, Matthias Emcke, Cinemedia, AFFC, Globe Film Company, Entertainment Finance Group and Instinct Entertainment
results.brief_description: Lyrical and moody, a reflective piece about first love, love lost and memories. Initially set in the 1960s in a small Victorian country town, a teenage boy returns home from boarding school to his father, the town doctor, and his best friend Silvy. On the night of the town dance Sam and Silvy slip away to go for a swim, unfortunately with dire consequences. Twenty years later Sam (Guy Pearce), now a psychologist, returns to fulfil his father’s final wish to be buried in Genoa. He meets a strange woman called Ruby (Helena Bonham-Carter) on the train and she proves to be a link for Sam back to his Silvy and his lost emotions. Written and directed by Michael Petroni in his feature film debut with original music composed by Dale Cornelius. Cast includes Frank Gallacher, Lindley Joyner, Brooke Harman.

results.title: Lumumba
results.creator_credit: Raoul Peck, Jacques Bidou, Arte France, Velvet SA, Essential Filmproduktion, Entre Chien et Loup and JBA Productions
results.brief_description: A political thriller that is the true story of a young African leader, elected at the age of 36 to become the first Prime Minister of the newly independent state of the Congo. Patrice Lumumba (Eriq Ebouaney) in the 1950s was fifty years before his time as he was seeking the ideal of a country free of colonial rule and a true democracy but he became a victim to corruption and powerful international big business interests. The film traces his journey from humble beginnings as a beer salesman to a voice of the people and great leader, finally to his torture and assassination. Powerfully acted and empathetically realised, this story resonates on two levels both as a personal life story of the man but also as an historical political account. Winner of a Peace Award at the Political Film Festival in the United States. A French, Belgian, German, Haitian co-production. Cast includes Alex Descas, Maka Kotto, Theophile Moussa Sowie, Andre Debaar.

results.title: Nausicaa of the valley of the wind = Kaze no Tani no Naushika
results.creator_credit: Hayao Miyazaki, Isao Takahata, Top Craft, Tokuma Shoten and Studio Ghibli
results.brief_description: Ecologically themed anime from famed Japanese director Hayao Miyazaki set in a post apocalyptic world whereby the air is poisoned and insects engage humans in fierce battles. Princess Nausicaa, the fearless leader of her imperilled tribe, is sympathetic to the insects that others fear and loathe, and understands that she must treat them with respect in order to achieve peace. Typically outstanding animation underscores a sensitive and earnest screenplay that, unusually for its time, steers away from the distinctive violence of anime and sets the tone for subsequent Ghibli studio works.

results.title: Love on the run = L'Amour en fuite
results.creator_credit: Francois Truffaut, Films du Carrosse and AMLF
results.brief_description: Fifth and final installment of Francois Truffaut’s “Antoine Doinel” cycle. Largely a series of flashbacks, this episode sees Antoine about to be divorced, and hence, reflective about his life. He is in love with Sabine but is filled with conflict about his responsibilities, in particular, his son, and is introspective the about the past. Aboard a train Antoine meets up with former love, Colette, and although they initially recall the past fondly, she subsequently berates Antoine for his lack of maturity and enduring self-absorption. This bittersweet work was largely derided as a disappointing end to an iconic series, but it maintains the lyricism and comical whimsy that are signatures of Truffauts “Doinel” work, whilst also being the most mediative.

results.title: Greetings
results.creator_credit: Brian De Palma, Charles Hirsch and West End Film
results.brief_description: A film very representative of the era and place in which it was made - New York late 1960s. “Greetings”, directed by Brian De Palma, is about three hip intellectual young men who come up with some novel ideas on how to avoid the draft that will send them to the conflict in Vietnam. Paul (Jonathan Warden), Jon (Robert De Niro) and Lloyd (Geritt Graham) present as gay and extreme right-wingers to the army all the while trying their best to seduce women to keep themselves occupied. This is a witty and satirical view of American culture at the time and is more a series of fun episodes in the protagonists’ lives than a straight-forward narrative. Co-written by Brian De Palma and Charles Hirsch and also edited by De Palma. Music by ‘The Children of Paradise’.

results.title: Forty guns = 40 guns
results.creator_credit: Samuel Fuller, Globe Enterprises and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: A classic example of the Western genre, written, directed and produced by maverick Samuel Fuller. Shot in black and white and “cinemascope” this lush film is filled with all you would expect from a Western: guns, fancy horse riding, showdowns and a bit of romance. The tough town femme-fatale Jessica Drummond (Barbara Stanwyck) has a posse of forty hired guns that make her the de facto leader of the County. She falls in love with a Marshall (Barry Sullivan) who arrives to restore law and order with tensions building up to a showdown.

results.title: Hideous kinky
results.creator_credit: Gillies MacKinnon, Ann Scott, BBC Film Unit and Film Consortium
results.brief_description: In an era about ‘love’ and the spiritual quest for the individual, young English mother of two Julia (Kate Winslet) goes on a journey with her two young children to live in Marrakech, Morocco 1972. Based on the novel by Esther Freud (daughter of painter Lucien) and told from the perspective of the youngest daughter, Julia throws herself into the local culture and with barely the means to support her girls with food and shelter. She is match-made by the children to a street performer and dubious local Bilal (Said Taghmaoui) and they soon become a couple. Exotic and enticing, more a visual feast than a dramatic quest, the film may challenge viewers’ notions of parenting, self-fulfilment and ultimately love. Some may just love the exotic travelogue nature that is the background of the Moroccan location. Soundtrack includes some memorable hits from the British charts of the 1960s/70s. The two performers in the roles of the daughters are captivating - eight year old Bea (Bella Riza) and six year old Lucy (Carrie Mullan) who are tired of mum’s adventures and just want to be ‘normal’. Directed by Gillies MacKinnon, with screenplay by his brother Billy MacKinnon.
